This app is in development and WILL have some jank in it. Please be patient as most issues are known and are being worked on.
The most obvious problem is the p0 generator prices, count, and pps labels. They currently start up with placeholder text, but can be fixed by clicking one of the buy buttons.

I am also aware that the numbers used are not balanced. I simply used powers of 10 as a placeholder until I get to a point where I can balance the numbers.

Thanks for your patience and understanding!
-Avnior

*Known Issue* -> Opening this settings screen breaks the game loop. This means that none of the generators will work (among other things).\n\nCurrent Workaround: Close and re-open the app. This should still save any changes made to these settings.

Welcome to Idle Core. The inspiration and goal for this game is to strip the idle/incremental genre down to its core concepts. There's no fluff here. No characters. No story. No needless graphics. Just pure idle/incremental gameplay.

What is the core goal of the idle/incremental genre? Progress. Some genres progress through story. Others through stats and gear. This genre? Get bigger numbers. It's that simple.

For ease of reference, I call these numbers points.

The first concept introduced is the manual click. This is the simple, "click the button, get a point". Not much more to explain.

The second concept introduced is the idea of automatic generation. Just click one of the buttons to buy one of the generators, and it will start giving you points over time. The earlier generators (starting with 1) cost less, but likewise generate less per second. However, they will provide a good base to start you off.

*COMING IN v1.0*
The next concept is what is often refered to as "prestiges". For the sake of this game, I've been calling these "resets", which is a little clearer as to what it does. The core idea is that by resetting, you earn a separate set of points that you can spend on something new. More on that in the next concept.
Resets often come in multiple layers, with a new version of resetting giving you yet another set of points. These different points and their respective layers are labled with numbers. On the bottom, you'll find the '⓪' button, which will bring you to the layer 0 screen which holds the assorted things you can do on that layer. At some point, you'll unlock the ability to reset layer 0 to earn ① (p1 points). After your first reset, you'll unlock the '①' button which takes you to the layer 1 screen.
Each layer's reset will reset all layers beneath it. This means that the higher layer resets will take longer to get back to after resetting, though it is worth it anyways since you will be able to get further in the end.
